action.action-desc: Mr. LaMalfa (for himself, Mrs. Roby, Ms. Sinema, and Mr. Swalwell of California) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: Expressing support for designation of August 2013 as Blue Star Mothers of America Month.

whereas.text: Whereas Blue Star Mothers of America, Inc. was founded as a patriotic service organization on February 2, 1942, with the purpose of uniting mothers with sons or daughters in the United States Armed Forces;

Whereas persons eligible for membership in the Blue Star Mothers of America include any woman who filled the role of birthmother, adoptive mother, step-mother, foster-mother, grandmother, legal Guardian of a service member at any time in that service members’ life who is currently serving in any branch of the United States Armed Forces, or has served and been discharged;
Whereas the work of the Blue Star Mothers of America includes—

paragraph.text: supporting members of the United States Armed Forces and veterans;
maintaining allegiance to the United States;
honoring those families whose children have died in service to the Nation;
upholding the United States principles of freedom, justice, and equal rights; and
defending the United States from all enemies, foreign and domestic;

whereas.text: Whereas the dedication of Blue Star Mothers of America is increasingly important with over 11,000 active members in 42 States of the United States with sons and daughters serving in the United States Air Force, Army, Marine Corps, Navy, and Coast Guard;

Whereas the Blue Star Service Flag is the official banner authorized by the Department of Defense for display by families who have members serving in the United States Armed Forces during any period of war or armed hostilities the Nation may be engaged in for the duration of such hostilities;
Whereas the loyalty, dedication, sacrifice, and hard work of the devoted members of Blue Star Mothers of America merit the utmost respect, acknowledgment, and recognition of the public; and
Whereas August 2013 would be an appropriate month to designate as Blue Star Mothers of America Month: Now, therefore, be it

paragraph.text: supports the designation of Blue Star Mothers of America Month; and

encourages all citizens to take time during the month to reflect and honor the dedication and sacrifice of the mothers of members of the United States Armed Forces and celebrate the rich history and contributions they have made to the great Nation.
